Package router

The router package contains classes to simulate a RIP router using sockets.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
Arguments The Arguments class parses and stores command line arguments.
Configuration The Configuration class parses, stores and validate a configuration for a particular router.
Configuration.Link The Link class represents two ports and a metric that is defined in a configuration file.
ConfigurationParser The ConfigurationParser parses configuration files into configurations.
DatagramService The DatagramService class provides datagram IO services.
DatagramService.Datagram The Datagram class represents an array of bytes and the interface it was received on or is to be transmitted on.
Router The Router class provides the core router functionality and manages the services provided by the router.
RouterClient RouterClient provides the client application for connecting to routers.
RouterDaemon  
RouterService The RouterService class represents a runnable service provided by the router.
VTYService RouterVTY class provides the Router VTY services.
 

Exception Summary
Arguments.ArgumentException The ArgumentException class represents an error that occurred while parsing the arguments.
ConfigurationParser.ConfigurationParserException The ConfigurationParserException class represents an error that occurred while parsing the building the Configuration.
 

Package router Description

The router package contains classes to simulate a RIP router using sockets.

The following documents are a useful reference:

  • Assignment: Simulating RIP
  • RIPv2 Specification (RFC 2453)
